(1)
Seaside Boulevard, south side, at the foot of Sand Lane, showing crowds walking toward South Beach. The view is east on the Boulevard.

July 4, 1929

June 2, 1935

P. L. Sperr

(1)
South Beach, Staten Island: A view east from about the foot of Beiret Avenue.

July 4, 1929

P.L. Sperr

(2)
Looking south toward the hotels and bungalows lining the beach, as seen from the foot of Andrews Street. In the foreground is an offshoot of New Creek.

August 25, 1929.

P.L. Sperr

(3)
At the end of Ocean Avenue, near Fort Wadsworth.

June 30, 1935.

P.L. Sperr

title: South Beach - Staten Island

text:
South Beach (Staten Island): Two views across the beach and the Lower New York Bay during life boat races at the opening of the new boardwalk. In the right background is partially visible Hoffman Island.

July 3, 1937
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Staten Island - South Beach - [New York Bay.]

text:

P. L. Sperr

P. L. Sperr

(3) A view north across the new boardwalk and May's Hotel, at about Xenia Street. May 30, 1937

P. L. Sperr

text:
South Beach-Boardwalk Opening: Staten Islanders turn out to celebrate the opening of the new boardwalk at South Beach, on the Lower New York Bay. The boardwalk was constructed by the Works Progress Administration.

P. L. Sperr

July 3, 1937
Views 1, 2, 3
title: Staten Island - South Beach - [Boardwalk opening.]

text:
South Beach-Boardwalk Opening: The parade for the opening of the new boardwalk at South Beach, Staten Island. The paraders are marching up the old walk, near Sand Lane.

P. L. Sperr
